channel.title: Unweildable items
channel.description: Like food, how can you make it so it does something else rather than wielding.

item.title: Unweildable items
item.dc:creator: @matzie matzie
item.description:
@matzie wrote:

can you just post a snippit of a piece of code for food, and the method for equipping. it would be much obliged ;D[i am on my desktop so my colon key works now :D!!]

Read full topic

item.title: Unweildable items
item.dc:creator: @matzie matzie
item.description:
@matzie wrote:

kingman002:

No it’s server side as I’ve done it before, I just forgot how as I haven’t coded in a while.

if you did it last time, it was probably a “work around” of the real way to do it =P look under the packet that has to do with wielding. you probably left yourself a hint there. and if it is sent though that packet (i’m sure it is because it makes you equip it) you can just put that
if (itemId==rocktailsID) {
i don’t know your source, but what ever handles food in yours[same thing as bones, just a different way]
but there should be a method in your server that controls eating, if you found that then link it from your wielding point to your eating point.
}//redneck workaround of java =]

Read full topic

item.title: Unweildable items
item.dc:creator: @matzie matzie
item.description:
@matzie wrote:

kingman002:

No, like I want it so I can’t weild an item, like you don’t Wield Lobster, you Eat Lobster, so say I added Rocktail in my Client, and changed the String to Eat, I have to do something server side to make it not wield but make it Eat

i don’t know the answer but i believe your problem is still client sided, because if it was sent through the wield packet it would do that, and there is one to be sent for item packets. i don’t know anything about client coding so that is as much as i can say ._.

but this should help you on your way to the answer,
search for how to add items to your client, find a tutorial for one that isn’t a weapon. as yours probably is all weapon stuff O_o?

Read full topic
